intro: Gymnopyrenium, commonly known as the slender puccoon, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. Gymnopyrenium species are native to North America and are often found in the central and western United States. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities and a subject of ecological study.
